column1: #Text=Gstaad is in the MOB ( Montreux Oberland Bernois ) railway line which runs from Montreux to Zweisimmen .
#Text=Some of the trains are Golden Pass Panoramic or Classic trains , which cost no more but are worth getting .
#Text=The Panoramic carriages have plenty of glass , which enables you to see more of the spectacular views as you climb up from Lake Geneva .
#Text=You can also book and pay extra to sit in right at the front of the train - the driver 's cabin is perched above your head and it feels like you are in charge .
#Text=The Classic carriages are all wood-lined and have waitress service for drinks - it 's like being on the Orient Express !
#Text=The trip from Montreux to Gstaad cost Fr . 48 return in 2008 and is worth it just for the scenery .
#Text=If you go during the Montreux Jazz festival you can catch a special jazz train , which has live music in dedicated carriages for a few francs extra .
#Text=In the winter there are ski buses , some of which ( the grey minibuses ) are free for everyone , while the fare on others in included in your lift pass .
#Text=In summer , if you 're staying three days , buy the Easy Access Pass ( Fr .
#Text=12 a day for adults ) which gives you virtually unlimited local travel , including most of the cable cars .
#Text=It also gives access to some of the fantastic outdoor swimming pools , including the enormous one at the Palace Hotel .
#Text=Take your time to enjoy the spectacular scenery and breathe in the mountain air !
#Text=In the winter , ski , snowboard , sledge or hike .
#Text=There are 220 km of trails served by 53 lifts .
#Text=It 's ideal for beginner or intermediate skiers , and what it lacks in serious black runs it more than makes up for in its off-piste and ski-touring opportunities .
#Text=Unlike other ski areas , this resort is spread out over several villages and not all lifts are linked .
#Text=( 25 km in winter , 10 lifts ) ( Take the postal car to Col du Pillon ) , ☏ +41848003000 , ✉ info@glacier3000.ch .
#Text=This ski area has its base station outside of the village , towards Les Diablerets .
#Text=Highlights of this ski resorts are the alpine coaster and a suspended bridge between two peaks .
#Text=In the summer , many of the lifts run .
#Text=You can hire mountain scooters to career back down , or have a go on one of the summer luges .
#Text=Hiking is magnificent in the summer : there are dozens if miles of marked trails .
#Text=You can find a via ferrata on the Horneggli and the Videmanette , with routes ranging from the trivial to the downright frightening .
#Text=Italian and typical Mediterranean food in a " Casual fine dining " atmosphere .
#Text=Stop in to sample some of the local pastries
#Text=( in the high street near the church ) .
#Text=A much cheaper option : good beer , great food , and frequented by locals , ski instructors and backpackers .
#Text=Landmark hotel featuring a spa and healthclub with indoor and heated outdoor pool , one squash court and 4 outdoor tennis courts .
#Text=Four star hotel in typical Swiss chalet style located only 0.5 km from the railway station in the center of the charming village .
#Text=There is a free shuttle service from the station to the hotel .
#Text=Two different restaurants and a great wellness area .
#Text=The ski lifts are reachable by foot in a few minutes .
#Text=Single room Fr . 154 Double room from Fr . 392 ( low season 2009 ) .
